text: Carl Edwin Wieman (born March 26, 1951) is an American physicist. He works at Stanford University. In 1995, while at the University of Colorado Boulder, he and Eric Allin Cornell created the first true Bose-Einstein condensate (BEC). In 2001, he won the Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Oregon Category:Stanford University faculty Category:Academics from Colorado
title: Carl Wieman
